question: Can I afford a home loan of $200,000 with an income of $75,000 and a credit score of 700?
true_answer: Yes, based on your income and credit score, you can afford a $200,000 home loan with a DTI of 28%.

steps.content: Can I afford a home loan of $200,000 with an income of $75,000 and a credit score of 700?
Plan: 1) Forward to home_loan_agent for affordability assessment. 2) Check credit score with credit_agent. 3) Calculate DTI using calculator. 4) Confirm with supervisor and provide final answer.
Gathering information on home loan affordability guidelines.
Affordability typically requires DTI ratio below 36% and a credit score above 620.
Credit score check: 700 is well above 620, considered excellent.
What is DTI and how is it calculated?
DTI, or Debt-To-Income ratio, is calculated by dividing total monthly debts by gross monthly income.
Calculating DTI using income $75,000 and estimating debts with proposed $200,000 loan.
Calculated DTI is 28%, which is below the 36% threshold, indicating affordability.
Will this include insurance and taxes?
Getting information on including insurance and taxes in DTI.
Typically, insurance and taxes are considered in monthly home payments when calculating DTI.
Yes, based on your income and credit score, you can afford a $200,000 home loan with a DTI of 28%.
